intro: Agalinis schwackeana, commonly known as the swamp evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or moist soils, often found in swampy areas and along riverbanks. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and branching. Agalinis schwackeana plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
